# Welcome! {.unnumbered}

This course introduces postgraduate students to advanced statistical methods used in the quantitative social, educational, and behavioral sciences. Students will learn:

-   Data management.

-   Analysis of Variance (ANOVA) Designs.

-   Multiple Linear Regression. Interaction between variables.

-   Principal Components Analysis and Factor Analysis.

-   Mediation and Path Analysis.

-   Basic Structural Equation Modeling (SEM).

-   Principles of Evidence Synthesis (Systematic reviews and Meta-analysis).

The students will also learn about the principles of data visualization and statistical software JAMOVI.
